Reviews.Title: Excellent Waterproof, Point & Shoot Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Luigi "Ping"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS10, when compared to other waterproof point & shoot cameras, is an excellent choice!  I've used a number of Olympus "Tough" cameras (6000, 8000, etc.) and the Panasonic competes more than admirably.Shutter lag seems to be a nagging issue with most waterproof, point & shoot cameras.  I find the DMC-TS10 has very little shutter lag--signficantly less than any waterproof, point & shoot Olympus I've used.  I can't tell you how irritating and frustrating it is to push the shutter and have a camera wait 1/2 to 1 second before it responds.The menu is much more intuitive and less "layered" than the Olympus cameras.  One nice feature is the ability to take a picture at any time regardless where you are in the menu system.  A simple, light touch of the shutter button brings you immediately into picture taking mode no matter where you are in the menu system.Picture quality is very good to excellent.  It won't compete with a digital SLR, but it is definitely above average in the waterproof, point & shoot category.  Battery life is also very good.  I was able to shoot almost 45 minutes of 720 HD video before the battery exhausted.  Note: you can only shoot approx. 8 min. of continuous video before you must start again.  Also, inexpensive aftermarket batteries are available; however, they must be "firmware" compatible with the DMC-TS10, otherwise they will not work.  As of this writing I was not able to determine the number of pictures that can be taken on one battery charge.The DMC-TS10 comes with an attractive silicone case that does an excellent job of protecting the camera both in and out of the water.One final note: if you read the various Amazon reviews, I think you'll find ALL waterproof, point & shoot cameras have some waterproof integrity issues.  All the waterproof, point & shoot cameras I've seen (regardless of price) have a very similar design in terms of access to the memory card, battery, and USB/power/charging connectors.  Bottom line, if you try to open the door on any of these cameras when the camera is wet in any way, you risk permananently damaging the camera.  From my experience, you have to let the camera sit for a few hours before attempting to open any of the access doors.  If you choose to not let the camera "air dry" and just dry the outside of the camera, water will remain underneath the edges of the doors.  The moment you open the door water gets pulled into the interior of the camera (via a vacuum affect) no matter how careful you are drying the camera.If you're looking for a waterproof, point & shoot camera, with good/excellent picture quality, minimal shutter lag/delay, good ease of use, and good battery life, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS10 is DEFINITELY worth considering!

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, noisy (fuzzy) images, works when it gets wet
Reviews.Author: Bob Tobias "Robert Tobias"
Reviews.Content: Bottom line:  Takes good snapshots if conditions are "just so" (bright but not harsh sunlight), even in the pool.What I liked: - It keeps working even when it's wet. - iA (Intelligent Automatic) mode, where the camera automatically selects among six of the more common scene modes. - The documentation is clear and complete. That applies to both the manual (provided electronically) and the information provided on-camera.What I didn't like: - Images at any ISO (sensitivity) setting are noisy (fuzzy).  They get very noisy at all but the lowest settings. - Zoom DOES NOT work when shooting videos. - It takes five button presses to go between taking pictures and movies.Other things: - This camera DOES NOT FIT in the Case Logic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage (Black).  However, the Case Logic TBC-312 Pocket Video Camcorder Case with Storage (Black) works fine.  (I have both.) - Watch the price.  I've seen it fluctuate on an almost daily basis.  The black version is particularly susceptible to price dips; I got mine for 66% of list. - A spare battery is good to have with a digital camera.  This is especially with this one becuase the battery life is on the short side.  Amazon has plenty of inexpensive aftermarket choices such as the MaximalPower DMW-BCH7 Li-Ion Rechargeable Digital Camera Battery for Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP1 DMC-FP2 DMC-FP3 DMC-FT10 DMC-TS10. - I've been using the Pentax Optio Floating Wrist Strap for Cameras for a long time and it works great with this camera.  It's comfortable and easily stays on the surface with this camera attached.Final Thoughts:  If you want a point and shoot camera that takes good pictures all the time look elsewhere.  If you want one that will work in and around the pool this is can be an "OK" value.  However, don't let the abundance of available features steer you away from considering a less expensive, more basic waterproof camera that could wind up taking better pictures.BTW, I feel that honest, effective reviews can take the place of first-hand experiences that are lacking in online shopping. I've always appreciated the help I've received from other reviewers and work hard to return the favor as best as I can.  I hope you found this review helpful and if there was anything you thought was lacking or unclear leave a comment and I'll do what I can to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the armchair adventurist
Reviews.Author: RK
Reviews.Content: I'm using waterproof cameras for over 20 years now.  Primary use is kayaking / canoeing / hiking, often multi day trips.This is a surprisingly small camera, easy to use and it takes great pictures. Took over 3000 pictures so far and the vast majority of them came out very good. Indoor flash pictures are a little bit iffy, without flash and a steady hand they usually turn out great. The "high speed burst mode" is amazing for a point and shoot camera and takes around 4 pictures a second (at a reduced 3 megapixel resolution).  Overall picture quality in the normal 14 MP mode is very good and compares well to the Canon 1300 IS.  The "intelligent auto" is reasonable good, but it is also easy to setup preferences.There are two things I don't like at all on this camera, the small, proprietary battery and the proprietary USB connector.The cell phone market finally agreed to use the same, standard USB connector, there is no reason why Panasonic couldn't do the same. A replacement USB cable from Panasonic retails for over $30. At least the camera is using a standard SD card, so if the USB cable is lost, it is not such a big deal to plug the SD card directly into the laptop, but again, I can't think about a technical reason why this camera has to use a proprietary USB connector.The small "DMW-BCH7" battery is more of an issue.  The strong point on the camera is the rugged, waterproof design.  There are several pages in the manual that emphasis how important it is to keep the waterproof seals around the battery compartment intact. Even a small brush is included to clean the gaskets. Obviously, any small piece of dirt or even just a hair caught in the seals will compromise the waterproof design.For a camera that is designed to be taken outside into the elements, I don't understand why it comes with a battery that lasts only around 200 to 250 pictures and a design that requires me to remove the battery for charging.  When was the last time we had to remove a cell phone battery or a laptop battery to charge?Even a small 4 GB memory card can hold 750 pictures in the standard 14 MegaPixel setting... why not have a battery that will last that long?  This would minimize opening the sealed battery door while outdoors.The included battery charger for this camera will only work for that particular battery model. So in our case, we have 3 different Panasonic cameras and need to travel with 3 different chargers! There just got to be a better way.If this camera could use standard AA rechargeable batteries it would be the perfect rugged outdoor camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Waterproof Camera. Survived snorkeling in the Carribean
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Hovik
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous when I first bought this camera after reading a review about the camera leaking underwater. I'm pleased to say it not only held up underwater but was there when I needed it.  My wife and I took a vacation with 1 week spent at Disney world and then 1 week in the Virgin Islands. I knew we would be doing a lot of snorkeling while in the Caribbean and I was praying the camera wouldn't leak and destroy all the pictures we had on it from Disney World. We took good care of it and followed the instructions to the letter before using it underwater and never had any issues. We left the silicon cover on it underwater so we wouldn't accidentally unlock the battery compartment. We snorkeled 1-3 hours a day for 6 days and the camera worked flawlessly.  Its a little pricey for what you get but it powers up fast, has descent zoom, lots of features, takes good action photos, the video recording is good, its compact and rugged and survived everything we threw at it. The battery lasted better than expected and never died on us. Overall I'm very pleased with this good looking camera.

Reviews.Title: Rugged, & versatile but more importantly waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Don J. Pham

} } } Length:: 0:25 MinsI've had the camera for two months now, and I've put it to the test.I'm a sailor, so i figure I'd need a camera for the elements I'll probably face out there, and this camera was definitely a good choice.-Video-The video included has been reduced in quality a bit to fit the limits of the 100mb upload onto amazon.I took it to the Aquarium and dunked it in for a video of Manta rays and Leopard sharks.It's original quality which was sitting at HD 1280x720 frame, 30fps, 29mbps bit rate, audio at 256kbps.However, it still looks great in this video which was downgraded to 25fps, 368x208 frame, 621kbps bit rate, 1.8mb, and audio at 74kbps.PROS:Works underwater!I have yet to push the camera to the depths of 10ft and more, mostly because I'm a little hesitant to really try that anytime soon (and risk losing the camera altogether).A good investment would be the Olympus' float strap for fishing trips, surfing, or if you plan on being on open waters.The orange helps locate it out there if you lose it. (Olympus STRAP FLOAT ORANGE)I also bought a Transcend 16GB class 10 memory card (Transcend 16GB Class 10 SDHC Card (TS16GSDHC10)) for it, and i get an upwards of 3000 pictures at 14mp.The design is sleek and compact. Beats a few other waterproof digital point and shooters that are less attractive.Compare for yourself at this nifty site i found before purchasing this model a few months ago:[...]CONS:-If there's a smudge, or water drop on the lens prior to shooting dry pictures they add random speckles on your pictures and can really detract from the shots. I suggest bringing a microfiber cloth around to clean the lens when you're dry.SUMMARY:Overall the quality of the pictures are decent, but the features are plenty.[New Edit 1 year ownership]: The images you process are noisy at any iso setting, as other users have mentioned, but for the work-ability & dependability you really can't go wrong with this model.

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Dime
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best Digital Cameras I have ever owned! If you are looking for a good camera for low light e.g. taking pictures at a club or concert this camera will capture images very well 100% satified! Alos great for taking very close up pictures and auto focus to get you the clearest picture. I have recommended this camera to both friends and family. Have not tried the water proof aspect of it yet so more to come. Recently I took a picture with me and the wife in a snow storm and it caught every flake very impressive.

Reviews.Title: READ THIS BEFORE BUYING - POOR QUALITY
Reviews.Author: G. A. P. "G.A.P."
Reviews.Content: This camera is offered at a very competitive price which enticed me to buy it for a recent trip. Now all I can think of is the old maxim "You Get What You Pay For."  In this case, I got a poor quality camera that even the manufacturer seems to acknowledge.  Here are my quarrels with this camera and why you may want to look elsewhere in spite of the low price:1. POOR PICTURE QUALITY - Maybe it's the lens or the quality of the electronics, but the pictures I did manage to take with this camera were washed out and otherwise of poor quality (particularly in bright light situations).  My camera phone did a better job in bright light situations.2. CONDENSATION ISSUES - I should have known something was up when Panasonic went so far as to put a special insert in the box about condensation issues and problems with the lens clouding over. Although Panasonic provides "tips" for avoiding this problem, my conclusion is that the design of this camera makes such issues unavoidable.  After only a few weeks, and even following all the tips, the lens on this camera clouded over from condensation.  The lens is now permanently cloudy and there is nothing you can do about it.  The camera is rendered useless.  I've used a lot of cameras in a lot of environments.  This one is just not designed to take it. I am going to send this camera in for warranty service and I will post an addendum to let you know how it turns out.  I'm not holding my breath that Panasonic will cover this problem.3. WATERPROOF SEALS ARE POOR QUALITY AND MUST BE REPLACED "AT EXTRA COST" YEARLY - That's right folks.  Read the fine print.  The requirements for keeping this camera waterproof read like a novel.  Even if you do everything right, Panasonic says the flimsy waterproof seals need to be replaced every year at your cost.  They surely don't tell you this up front. Can you imagine having to bring this $140 camera to an authorized repair facility every year and being charged for replacing the seals?  Nobody is going to do that and Panasonic knows it.  It's basically a disposable camera if you bring it in the water to begin with.  After one year Panasonic admits it.  Mine didn't make it past two months.I love praising a good product at a good price.  This camera is not such a product.  In my humble opinion, you would be better off spending a little more and getting a better waterproof camera that is truly as rugged as they claim.ADDENDUM: OF COURSE PANASONIC BLAMED ME FOR THE CAMERA HAVING CONDENSATION DAMAGE AND REFUSED TO HONOR THE WARRANTY. CLAIMS THERE IS CORROSION BUT THEY HAVE NO PHOTOS SHOWING IT. WITH A STRAIGHT FACE THEY OFFERED TO FIX A $139 CAMERA (PRICE I PAID)FOR $189 AND ASKED ME HOW I WOULD LIKE TO PAY FOR THE REPAIR. WOW - YOU WOULD HAVE TO BE A KNUCKLEHEAD TO EVER AGAIN DEAL WITH PANASONIC AND THEIR PRODUCTS.

Reviews.Title: The best waterproof camera for under $300 - UPDATE!
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Young
Reviews.Content: UPDATE (May 24, 2012):My camera was 15 months into a 12 month warranty, this camera stops working. Water got in the battery and SD compartment. Now I can turn the camera on and take a single picture, that's it. I can't operate any of the buttons on the back. Essentially this is now useless to me.I went back and read the manual more carefully and it states that the seals would deteriorate in about a year's time. Way to go Panasonic for making a product that's only supposed last 12 months.I contacted Panasonic and they asked me to send it in to see how much it would cost to repair it (since it's out of warranty). They quoted me $180.25, which is more expensive than simply buying a brand new one!----------Remember those days when our options were limited to a waterproof disposable camera or a crazy expensive casing? That was only about five years ago and all of a sudden we have many choices!I've tried several waterproof cameras and this is by far the best that I've found (in case you're curious, the worst was Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)). Don't even consider using one of those Kodak video cams for pics since those are terrible in low light and have no optical zoom. Here's how this Lumix performs in various conditions:-OUTDOORS/DAY-Like most cameras, pictures are incredible when brightly lightly lit, especially outdoors. These pics are right up there with my Canon Powershot.-INDOORS-More noise than I'd like but still respectable. If well-lit and subject isn't moving, pictures are decent.-LOW LIGHT-Not good at all but I didn't expect pics from a waterproof camera to be good in low light conditions. I'll use my regular point-and-shoot or my SLR for these purposes.-UNDERWATER-Some of the best underwater pics you can ask for. No blur at all when in a pool, even when cloudy. I'm assuming if the water is clear, like the Caribbean, this camera will do what you need it to do - take clear, vivid pics.-SNOW-Yes, it's perfect in the snow too. Due to the generally bright environment when around snow, pics come out pretty good and there's no need to worry about using it with wet gloves. My hands are happy.In short, for indoor and low light shots, I use another camera. Almost all other times I'll have this in my pocket due to its durability and flexibility. With several kids in tow, this camera is almost always on my person when we're out.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera from Panasonic
Reviews.Author: PK5353
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera before taking a trip to Mexico in September 2011.  It's not the most expensive camera, so I was hoping for it to last the trip.  It performed admirably.  Went swimming in the Carribean and used the camera without any leakage.  Pictures are acceptable and can be tweaked with Photoshop.  Went snorkeling in brackish and salt water a few days later and was pleased with it's performance.  It did not leak and the pictures were good of the fish and underwater terrain.  Understand these are not going to look like something out of National Geographic, but the results will bring back some pleasant memories.  One thing I did do was inspect the camera and seals after reading the manual thoroughly.  After using it I let it sit in fresh water for a while then wiped and let it dry off.  Only then did I open the door for the SD Card and battery.  I also let it dry open for an hour or so, wiped the gaskets and then carefully closed the door.I'm taking it with me on another vacation shortly.

Reviews.Title: Some quirks, but GREAT for reviewing frame-by-frame video
Reviews.Author: Todd Minnella
Reviews.Content: I have tested the camera's waterproof-ness (on purpose) and drop-proof-ness (by accident, onto concrete) and it is still doing great.  I also like that this camera has no protruding lens and easily fits in your pocket.I use this camera almost exclusively for HD video at amateur sporting events.  If you have a need to take and very quickly review video frame-by-frame, this camera is OUTSTANDING at it.  The buttons/interface for play/pause and prev/next frame are all right there - you don't have to navigate around to find the "next frame" menu item, like you do on some other cameras.  It is very easy and very fast to use.The quirk that I have come to work around is that this camera does not stop recording when you press the button to stop.  Instead, it trims the video to 1-2 seconds BEFORE you pressed the button to stop recording.  So I have learned to just let it record well past the event that I want to review before stopping the recording.The battery has lasted me about 60 minutes of near-constant use (recording, then reviewing frame-by-frame video).

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: V. Price "Vincent"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my family vacation -- I had ruined a non-waterproof panasonic camera by taking it to the beach a couple of years ago.This camera was wonderful.  It took great beach pictures; it was great for my family's outing at the water park; and my wife and kids got a great kick out of taking pictures under water in the pool with it.  The camera opened up photo opportunities we've never realized before.The camera's indoor photo performance is not great -- when it comes to indoor picture quality, it doesn't even match up to my point-and-shoot panasonic camera from 4 years ago.  Indoor pictures that came out were grainy and way too contrasty.  However, this camera takes great outdoor (daylight) pictures, and it can take pictures in wet and sandy conditions that ended up damaging my older camera.All in all, the DMC-TS10 makes a great little vacation camera.

Reviews.Title: Just as I hoped
Reviews.Author: MariaT
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could take to the beach or sledding and not have to worry.  My kids can handle it and drop it, I can throw it from the water up to the sand, and I do not have to worry which is the biggest selling point for me.  As far as quality, I own a DSLR so I am use to having really nice quality in my photos, this one performs satisfactory.  Not great, but not too bad.  Video is also not great, but at least I can take videos and not worry about getting things wet.  I've been testing the camera out when swimming or letting my kids drop it and so far in the last month it has held up without complaint.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Smack
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with this camera. I already own a small Nikon Coolpix, but I wanted a waterproof camera only to use for snorkeling or swimming in the pool. But I have found that this camera has better picture quality than my Nikon (which is a couple of years old). I just returned from a trip to St Lucia, where we swam in the ocean three different days and swam in the pool every day for a week. The camera performed great. When looking at customer reviews, I noticed that the Panasonic had better reviews than the Olympus and some of hte others, and now I see why. Buying this older model, kept it within the same price range as the Olympus also.

Reviews.Title: Avoid
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased this camera for the sole reason of taking undwerwater pictures on my vacation.  I did a few test shots out of water and the pictures came out well.  I took the camera into a pool with me and it lasted all of 3 minutes underwater before the lens, flash, and lcd internally fogged up.  I had followed the instructions to properly clean, check and seal the camera prior to underwater usage and the camera still failed.In talking with Panasonic, they are only willing to give me a refurbished replacement even though I was within the 30 day period.I would avoid this product and Panasonic altogether for "waterproof" cameras.  The camera was defective and Panasonic is clearly not in the business of customer satisfaction/retention.

Reviews.Title: cannot get pictures off of camera
Reviews.Author: cardinalB "Go Razorbacks!"
Reviews.Content: I have not been able to get the pictures off this camera.  connected the cable to the camera and my pc and I get an error every time.  I cannot find the software or box it came with (yes my fault) but who knew the software was not downloadable from panasonic?  I'm not a computer dummy either.  I called panasonic and they offered for me to purchase the software for $22 and it's back ordered for two weeks!  So I have no idea how well the pictures turn out as they are trapped on my camera.panasonic warranty department: 800-211-7262panasonic parts: 800-833-9626

Reviews.Title: Good pick for daily rough and tough use.
Reviews.Author: SID
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my recent Hawaii trip. I used it pretty much in all water activities like Snorkeling, Snuba (upto 20ft in ocean, Parasailing, Hiking, Pool and Hot Water tub (103 F)and it worked just fine.Pros:- Swapping the modes (still to video and the other way around) is not that bad.- Easy to wash after use and dries out pretty quickly.- They provide a rubber case for better grip when you are in the water.- Fast shutter speed.- 14 MP camera: The picture and video quality is really good.- Battery life is really good.Cons:- The only con that I can think about is, once you start recording a video, zooming is not possible. You need to adjust your zoom before you start recording.

Reviews.Title: The BEST underwater camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: glasscastle
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of homework before buying my underwater camera and I decided on this one. I absolutely LOVE it. I took it on a cruise to Mexico and I took pictures underwater while I was snorkeling, in the pool, in a Jacuzzi (even though you really shouldn't). The image quality is great although the menu screen is a bit outdated, it takes good pictures. I also love that you can drop it and nothing will happen to it (my last digital fell when my boyfriend put it on self timer and it fell). The color is beautiful and your friends will definitely want to borrow it to take pictures in places their cameras won't go. On the cruise, two sets of girls asked us to take underwater pictures of them and email the pictures to them because they saw how much fun we were having with it. It's a great camera that is definitely going to last you a LONG time whether you have kids that like to play with your gadgets or are a beach person or like to do underwater activities.

Reviews.Title: Best value for underwater photography (Panasonic DMC-TS10)
Reviews.Author: David a/v fan
Reviews.Content: I searched far and wide for a decently priced underwater camera, since I only intended to use it FOR underwater. However, it takes far better pictures than my existing (non waterproof) Panasonic. So it's now become my primary point & shoot, for all purposes. And as far as water shots go, what a treat. The first time I went into the pool with it, I was very very nervous - could it really survive getting dunked? But it did, no problems, and after seeing the results, I was, and remain, ecstatic. Trust me, seeing a bunch of kids grinning & giving you the thumbs up underwater is a real treat.Value wise, I got it at a really low price point on Amazon, but even at its normal price, it's great value. All the other waterproof cameras are either really expensive or cheap and crapy. This is the only decent one at a reasonable price. No, it's not a DSL, but compared to other point and shoots, it's well above average.

Reviews.Title: Tears-of-Joy-Proof
Reviews.Author: F. Marin "Lots of laughs"
Reviews.Content: You know why you are looking to buy this camera. It is more than enough that this inexpensively little rugged camera is SHOCK & WATERPROOF, it went and made itself dust proof too. No more dust bunnies sneaking into your photos.I can rail on about its many great qualities that you have read before, but let me explain something others found to be negative. Other reviewers will say that going back and forth between taking pictures and shooting video is a hassle. Let me explain how to make it simple: If you were to select the video mode and wanted to switch back to taking pictures, all you have to do is press the "iA" button (next to the shutter button) and you can instantly click away. At this point you can alternate back and forth between taking "iA" assisted pictures and shooting videos by pressing the "iA" button.There are many great reasons to buy this camera, like price, durability, awesomeness (I hope my 5 star rating made it in), versatility and design ingenuity, but do not let other negative reviewers sway you with their nay sayin'. Say, yes.Happy photo-shooting.

Reviews.Title: Not a Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "The Johnsons"
Reviews.Content: First thing this camera did was make me aware of how much better the image quality of my DSLR is.  I haven't looked at point and shoot pictures with any kind of criticism since last Christmas, and I was originally disappointed with the quality of these pictures.  They tend to be a little noisy/fuzzy, and not necessarily "tack sharp," BUT THEY'RE FROM A POINT AND SHOOT THAT IS WATER PROOF!  I bought this camera because my hubby regularly dumps us over in the canoe on float trips and there is no rational way to excuse taking more than a grand in camera equipment down river when you know it's going into the water sooner or later.  Have already had previous issues with supposed "water tight bags," not GOING there.  So, a waterproof camera became a "must."This camera is great for fun snap shots and at fairly close range.  The zoom makes you feel like you got maybe 40 or 50 feet closer to whatever you were looking at (at least that was how it felt when I went from unzoomed to zoom from my front porch looking towards my barn and arbor - I had gotten across the front yard and was maybe ten feet from the arbor at "full zoom."  Don't expect to hear a blackbird in the tree a hundred yards away and zoom in on this thing and get a "right beside it" style picture.  Not happening, and with the IQ, you're not going to be able to crop out a really interesting bird picture, either.However, if you're canoeing, at the pool, at the beach, etc., and you want a camera that you don't have to have a heart attack about if you set it down on a beach towel and it comes in contact with sand, or if you take it into the water and some gets splashed on it (do NOT take it to a lower depth than recommended or force water at it because that will invalidate the warranty; also read and review manufacturer's instructions regarding the seals and how to clean the camera after it has been exposed to various elements), this camera is for you.  I think I will enjoy it on my next float trip, even though I'll never get the breath-taking shots I would hope for from this.  Maybe one day I'll get some of my DSLR pictures published/sold and be able to afford to look at higher resolution, better waterproof cameras (maybe pigs will fly, too, because if I got that much money I'd be investing it in an f/2.8 zoom lens), but for what I wanted it for and what its capabilities should be, it meets the test very well.  Since I wasn't bowled over and thrilled by the image quality, though, I'm just going to give it four out of five instead of five stars.Oh - on LCD shooting - the screen hasn't given me trouble in any light (unless you're in some kinds of sunglasses, then you kind of have to look underneath them).  Really it is more than bright enough for regular-style shooting.  :)

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: The camera is reliable and we have not had any problems with it. The only thing it could really use is more of an optical zoom. There several higher Lumix models that do have zoom and GPS. If you just want a decent camera for a decent price, this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE - Discontinued Charger & Batts
Reviews.Author: P. Healy
Reviews.Content: I just bought the Lumix TS10 as a backup camera for an upcoming international trip. I spent an hour on the phone with Panasonic, both the Parts Dept. & the Tech Support, to get an additional charger, the DE-A75B, and Battery DMW-BCH7PP. DISCONTINUED & NO REPLACEMENTS AVAILABLE. Unbelievable! Panasonic offers this camera as a currently available item, but they have no accessories available? So, I have to settle for some 3rd party knock-offs. Panasonic, what's your problem?

Reviews.Title: Warranty Repair Joke
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrible for water shooting plain and simple.  This camera was a week old I followed the directions to the T on how to use it in water.  Well it failed the 1st time and they say it is not covered by warranty and the flat service fees 180.  I did not even pay 180 for it why would I spend more to fix it than I paid for it.  I even had to pay 10 bucks to send it to them as a warranty repair to find out it was not covered.  Send me a box and pay for shipping like Apple does when its warranty.

Reviews.Title: nice little toy
Reviews.Author: Carlo Sendaydiego
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Took good pictures, but the video was even better. Just used it in Maui snorkeling and through the pounding waves boogie boarding and it kept taking great video. For the video alone its worth it. Used to digital slr quality picture so pictures from this little gem cannot match up, but they're still good. Its small so it fits well in your pocket so take it anywhere unlike dslr. Overall I like it. Good bang for your $.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: marissa
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera from Amazon Warehouse. The condition was as described (like new), only with the box being beat up. So far, the camera functions great for what we intended to use it for - water and outdoor use. Have taken the camera both into the pool and beach, with no issues. Definitely now a DSLR, but it is a fun little camera that can take some abuse!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn Cooper
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my 7 year old daughter for her birthday. She loves taking pictures, and the old Fisher Price camera she got when she was 3 wasn't cutting it anymore with its blurry images and poor quality. She loves this camera and takes it everywhere. It stands up to everything a 7 year old girl puts it through - she has dropped it, fallen with it on her wrist, banged it into furniture while having it strapped to her wrist.Some things to note - it is ALWAYS attached to the wrist strap on her wrist, and it is ALWAYS in its silicone sleeve.The camera has terrific battery life - this girl loves to make movies of herself and her little brother, and takes a million pictures a day. The image quality is very good. All in all, this is a great camera for the price, and is good for a responsible child.

Reviews.Title: Great Durable Camera With Above Average Image Quality For Its Class
Reviews.Author: wasomma
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera several weeks ago and so far I am very impressed. The durability is through the roof, I'm in the military and I toss my helmet bag around with the camera in it quite a bit and so far no damage. I've swam in pools and in the ocean with it above 10 feet and I've had zero issues.About image quality you have to remember the camera is what it is. Its a highly durable waterproof digital camera with an internal lens mechanism. It takes above average quality pictures for its class, but it's not a high quality camera lens. It takes great pictures, I will submit several pictures I've taken with the camera and you can decide for yourself. But keep in mind the pictures are great for the average point and shoot user but more advanced camera owners it will leave much to be desired.I've given the camera 4 stars in image quality for the reasons I listed before and 4 stars in shutter lag as it has a long shutter lag at about a second (certainly not a scientific measurement). Other than that, it's a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Not really waterproof nor weatherproof camera
Reviews.Author: A. Camama "agc"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great but not an ideal outdoor camera, which defeats the purpose of being called as a waterproof.Sudden change of room temperature creates condensation inside the lens.  This condensation, overtime, can mess up the circuits due to rust.  If you call the Panasonic support, they will just tell you that it is normal for the condensation to happen.  That is a big lie.  Return the camera right away and demand a refund since that no waterproof camera should have condensation inside.I attempted several times to get this replaced but to no avail.  They always tell me that they will give you me a refurbished camera rather than a replacement.If you want a more reliable and a real waterproof camera, get the Olympus brand who started the waterproof and shockproof portable mini cameras.  The one we have has been working well no matter what temperature you bring it in.  It is now about 4 years old and we never have any kind of problem such as the silly condensation issue with the Panasonic camera.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Schunke "CombativesGo"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera specifically to use while snorkeling since we are stationed in Hawaii. We were a little apprehensive based on other user reviews that claim the camera broke their first time using it submerged, but we decided to try it out, anyways, based on the positive reviews and the excellent price.We purchased this camera mid November, 2011, and I waited this long to write the review so I could give a detailed account of how well/poorly it works. Let me start by saying that we are thrilled with this purchase and really recommend this to anyone who may be interested! We have used it on several occasions, most of which were snorkeling excursions where the camera was submerged all or most of the time. We have not had any problems with leakage or damage to the camera as a result of extended periods of time in the salt water, and I believe that as long as proper care and cleaning procedures are followed that anyone else should have the same experience as we have had.The picture resolution is great and we have even used pictures taken with this camera in professionally printed photo books and gotten high praise for how well they look. Please see the photos we've added to this product page for reference.The display is easily visible under the clear waters of Hawaii, and it is easy to use so I never miss a picture! The iA (intelligent auto) feature has been wonderful for me, especially considering I am not very good with technology in general, and I'm no photographer, so I wouldn't know what settings to use. I have never had a problem with the pictures looking bad because of the setting with this camera.We have gotten much more than our money's worth out of this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Having broken my Olympus 2 weeks before a Hawaiian vacation, I was worried about this camera not living up to my expectations (based on having my Olympus for years). It far surpassed any and all expectations! The shutter speed was a million times faster, which is great when you're trying to catch the fish or turtles! The image quality is good for a point and shoot. I have been really pleased with it; dry and wet! Fantastic for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: nice rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Craig H
Reviews.Content: My Fuji xp10 waterproof camera died for no apparent reason, so I bought this panasonic to take on a 5k mud obstacle race.  It held up just fine, took nice pictures and at the end I just rinsed it off.  I like the silicone bumper cover that comes with it.  It's just a point and shoot camera, so I don't expect high end performance, but I can take it snorkling or white water rafting or skiing without worrying about it and get pictures I never would have gotten  with my SLR.

Reviews.Title: it's a winner
Reviews.Author: aloha girl
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera with the intention of beach pictures, family visiting Hawaii..the auto matic "take a great picture "feature is price less..  I looked great at the sunset  on the kayak  and the turtles and manta rays didn't have to stop playing every shot a winner... Yes it was the best purchase of our vacationnow if we can only win the promotion of another week's stay Life would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: In one word, WOW!
Reviews.Author: D. Rubens
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a snokeling trip to Bora Bora. I was a little reluctant to spend this much money, but I cannot over-emphasize how pleased I am with the performance the quality of this camera. It takes amazingly clear photos and videos both in and out of the water. I had it fully submerged in salt water for up to 6 hours per day, and it continued to work flawlessly. The friends I was traveling with were equally impressed by the quality of the photos and videos. I could go on and on, but I'll just conclude by saying that if you are thinking about purchasing this camera, don't hesitate. I'm so glad I didn't buy something less expensive or a disposable because now I have some truly great pictures and videos from our trip and not a bunch of blurry, washed-out, low quality junk.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: dstone
Reviews.Content: great camera, nice features, pretty easy to use. i don't take it snorkeling or anything i go boating so i wanted a camera that could get wet.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera, reasonable price
Reviews.Author: L. Thompson
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a snorkeling trip to Cozumel, after doing a little research on waterproof housings and cameras.  I don't normally give 5-star reviews, but I am really happy with the quality of this camera, particularly since it was much cheaper than a lot of the other options we were considering.  This camera was about the same price as the good waterproof housings, and I liked not having to risk ruining our nicer digital cameras.  There were 'better' cameras on Amazon, but the reviews were only slightly better for an extra $100 or so, so we decided to take a risk on this one.  I'm so glad we did - it worked great underwater, even after opening and closing the battery compartment a few times (of course after drying it thoroughly).  We used it at least 8 different times in the water, and were amazed at the quality of the pictures it took.  We did have to lower the resolution, because set at its highest resolution, the stock memory card only holds about 8 pictures, but they still turned out really nice.  We will probably invest in another memory card for our next trip, though!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS10 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: fan
Reviews.Content: Is a great camera,the picture quality is very good.After taking several shots both indoor and outdoor I took them for printing that was when I realized how good the pictures were.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Watson
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera just about every day since I got it. Takes great pics in and out of the water. Battery life is good, I've used it all day while boating, tubing and swimming and changed th battery once. Took about 400 pics that day and about 15 min of video.The only thing that I can find any fault with at all is when you open the battery/sd card compartment you are supposed to brush the contacts off with a little brush to ensure there is no dust on them....every time. Minor annoyance, but still love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I just came from my honey moon, where i took pictures everywhere including underwater, i would say that the quality of the pictures are great as well as the video, simple to use, no filtrations after use it in a river or sea. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: sidneyyliraaax3
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product at about 3 yesterday and had 2 day shipping. I already have it here in my hands. The speed shipping was faster than i expected. The camera itself is also extremely nice. It takes quality pictures out of the water but i haven't tried it underwater yet. The directions include very specific instructions on cleaning and use for underwater. It is really easy to use and the locks for waterproof are very easy to understand. It was definitely worth the money especially because the box includes the camera, a wrist strap, a silicone case (specially designed to the camera), and a special brush for cleaning. I am more than pleased.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase!!
Reviews.Author: Tippy94
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a 13 year old girl.  She LOVES it!  Easy to operate.  Features that anyone can use and figure out with relative ease.  The photo quality, as well as the video quality, is great. Easy to share and view the photos.  Great value for the price.  She has only had it 4 weeks and we feel that we have already gotten our money's worth from it.  She did all the research on it beforehand and knew this was the one she wanted, given the price limits she had been given.  We would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof, rugged, compact camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good cam for kayaking and rough outdoor activities.  The silicone jacket is especially appealing because it protects the camera exterior from dings (except the LCD screen, of course) It is also very compact.  Image quality is good.  Good value at the Amazon price.  I like the Kodak pocket cameras for video but they cost almost as much as the TS10 but have no flash and no optical zoom and no OIS.  Their video is an excellent 1080p, however, whereas the TS10 is 720p.  Can't have everything...yet.Cons: Will not optically zoom while recording video.  Does not have a dedicated video button, but you can set it up so that using the iA button on top of the camera will switch between video and iA mode.  You still have to press the shutter button to start and stop the recording.  (I actually like using the shutter button better than a dedicated video button, which is usually on the back of the camera and somewhat difficult to press.)  The TS10 video format is .mov.  I prefer AVCHD Lite. because it gives files about half as large as .mov (based on a comparison with my Panasonic DMC ZS7, which has AVCHD Lite).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Matthias Mulvey
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few years now and it still takes great pictures. I have had no problems with it. I have a rubber cover over it in case I drop it and it fits in the cloth case well.

Reviews.Title: Not Great
Reviews.Author: AmKiwi
Reviews.Content: Works ok but I think the picture quality is fairly poor. Small viewer. Clunky to hold in your hand. Takes a special battery and charger. You can do better than this camera.

Reviews.Title: Rugged quick camera
Reviews.Author: Dale wood
Reviews.Content: this camera is small and is almost instant on, I can take pictures for two weeks on one charge. its taken the abuses of the Quetico provincial park, New Mexico,  Philmont , Yellowstone, Shawnee river to river trail, and random kayaking/camping adventures.  great for snapping pictures anywhere.

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof
Reviews.Author: KristinK10
Reviews.Content: Used this camera twice. Took great pictures and I liked the functions it offered. However, I took it underwater and followed the instructions to the tee to make sure I did everything right, but water got into the battery compartment anyway. The battery swelled and the camera no longer worked. I just ordered a new battery and we will see if it helps.

Reviews.Title: waterlogged after 4 trips in 1.5 years
Reviews.Author: SFgirl
Reviews.Content: Bought this waterproof camera for beach vacations.  Took four beach vacations in 1.5 years.  On the fourth one, the camera stopped working while we were snorkeling in the ocean.  When we got back on the boat, realized it was water-logged.  I've always been very careful with care of the camera, soaking it in regular water after each use, brushing away the sand, etc etc.  I'm very disappointed with the product, given that it didn't last that long despite proper care.

Reviews.Title: great tough camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick Shepard
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera for my verous outdoor adventures.  the camera takes great pictures and videos both above and below water.  i have used it snorkeling, hiking, climbing, kayaking, biking and it has held up to everything.  This has been a great camera that i would recommend for anyone who enjoys the outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Not good for WW Kayaking
Reviews.Author: Paul "jackofalltrades"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to be used primarily while whitewater kayaking. While it takes decent pictures when the lens is dry the lens does not repel water very well. This results in water spots and fog on the lens (when there is a difference in air and water temps) making it extremely difficult to take clear photos while on the river. I have tried anti fog and water repellent agents on the lens without any real success. Another major draw back to this camera it is SLOW, slow to turn-on and slow to focus, making for many missed photo opts. On the plus side, it is water proof and rugged. I know Panasonic has newer versions of the camera but I would not try unless they come with a new water repellent lens. This camera is not a good choice for kayaking. It seems better suited for hiking in the rain or perhaps for under water activites such as snorkaling.

Reviews.Title: Its been very good to me
Reviews.Author: denys Salinas
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a cruise. It was worth the price I paid. I live by the coast. I go to the beach and pool year around and this camera has been through a lot. Although the underwater pictures are not the best quality , I didnt have to worry about getting the camera wet and I have decent underwater pictures. I have put this camera through a lot of aquatic use with little care to maintenance and after nearly 2 years Im now noticing water drops inside. I plan to upgrade soon and will stay with the brand.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera, great pictures and waterproof too!
Reviews.Author: Paul "gismoman"
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera.  I bought one open-box for under a c-note and just wasn't sure what to expect from it.  Wow!  This is a really great all around camera.  Easy to use, very much point and shoot and the photos uniformly come out very, very good. After one year of owning it, I don't think I've gotten a single out of focus picture from it.  It's been in the pool, river, mud, and to the beach.  No problems with leaking or fogging up.  I've been though many, many digital cameras, and I've grown very fond of Canon cameras for their consistent picture quality.  Now, I have another camera that I can feel safe to grab in a hurry if I can't find the Canon because I know I won't miss a photo-op or end up blurry.  The video feature works well also, but I wish it had the ability to zoom while filming.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  Small and handy.  Takes good pictures.  Not a professional camera, but I'm not a professional.  You should get you one.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Lynn A. Padgett "LAP"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera about 2 years and have used it under water many times.  No problems.  Excellent pictures in and out of water, good color quality.  Great to stick in your purse when you think you might want to take some pics but don't want to take a larger camera.  Excellent battery life.

Reviews.Title: Does Exactly what I was designed for, taking good pictures Everywhere
Reviews.Author: Guillermo
Reviews.Content: This Camera Takes Really Good Pictures as a regular Point and Shoot and It Performs really Good Underwater.We took it on our honey moon (beach location) and I was GREAT, took really sharp Images Everywhere.Real value compared to Nikon and Canon Underwater cameras for way more than 300 usd....

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Ashley Scarlavia
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for every day use and it's amazing because I can take it on vacation, even in water and pictures turn out great! I've read the basic instructions for care and I've never experianced any problems with water seeping in. I've dropped the camera and it's always been fine! It's perfect and I couldn't ask for anything more suited to my needs. Great deal too!

Reviews.Title: Perfecto
Reviews.Author: Wendy Fermin
Reviews.Content: Entrega en tiempo establecido por el vendedor, producto nuevo y en perfecto estado y correctamente embalado. Compre con toda confianza

Reviews.Title: Waterproof with great photos!
Reviews.Author: Susan Jagosz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise to the Bahamas, where we snorkeled often. The camera was everything I expected, with even better quality photos than I though I would get.  If you make sure to follow the cleaning instructions, this camera will maintain it's waterproof integrity for years while taking beautiful photos of all your aquatic adventures. It should be a good camera for snow too, though I haven't tried it yet. The camera is small and easy to use. We attached a small float to wear around our wrist so the camera wouldn't sink to the bottom of the sea. It worked perfectly!This camera is great for ordinary shots on land, too.  The 14 megapixels insures a crisp, detailed photo. I'm very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof enough
Reviews.Author: ah
Reviews.Content: Bought this middle of August 2011. Produced decent pictures, both on land (in dry and wet conditions) and during short underwater trips (tried it kayaking, in a pool, short snorkeling excursion). Never had the fogging issue that others mentioned, but I took it on a longer snorkeling (45+ minutes) trip recently (Dec 2012) and apparently camera couldn't handle it. Completely stopped working and won't come back to life, even after I dried it out for several days. The seals seem kind of crappy, as others have remarked. We have another cheap Kodak Sports, which has also lost most of its water-proof ability, but at least for that one, if it gets overly wet and stops working, one can dry it out and it comes back to life. Not for the Panasonic one. Now I'm looking for a better and more reliable brand.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix takes great underwater pictures!
Reviews.Author: Tall Trees
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical of purchasing this camera for my daughter, but I'm glad I did!  She took it to a waterpark this past summer and took it on every ride.  She even took some awesome underwater pictures!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Nelson Gruber
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic Lumix TS-10 works perefctly in every enironment I have gone to, underwater, a pool, at the beach, mud, the only thing I have not tried it yet is snow, but I'm going to Berlin on the 24th and beleive I'll let you know how it works... The only thing I don't like is taht is a little bulky, but I don't mind that very much becasue I have bbig hands... But it's a little bit bigger than a normal camera...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mamatusi
Reviews.Content: Works great underwater and above water. Has a lock to keep water out. Have had it about a year now and still love it!

Reviews.Title: Quality and features meets easy to use
Reviews.Author: Tiffany McDonald
Reviews.Content: This camera has been in extreme environments and has remained unscathed, and the picture quality is magnificent! My department all shares this camera and have brought it into places covered in coal dust and even through a heavy rain storm and it still works beautifully. It was also a nice surprise to see it comes with a clear rubber protective case too. Picture clarity was very important for our uses and it exceeds our needs. Despite the many features of this camera, it is still easy to operate. The menus are self-explanatory and the functions arent complicated. It has every feature we would want from this too so I highly recommend this for anyone really. Great price too for a fantastic camera. Shipping also went well. It arrived on time and in excellent condition. I not only would buy from this vendor again, but I think I am now hooked on Panasonic cameras in general.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: wilson
Reviews.Content: productos cumple con lo requerido, producto recomendado, llego a tiempo tal como decía la fecha de arribo bien envalado. ok

Reviews.Title: Checked Consumer Reports and ordered this camera.
Reviews.Author: A. H.
Reviews.Content: This camera will replace the Olympus Stylus 1030SW I now have.I've had the Olympus for several years and it still works without issue(s); poor image quality is the reason for replacing the Olympus with the Panasonic.Some links to Consumer Reports information:Never mind...Amazon apparently doesn't allow links to outside sites.Pity.Once the Lumix is delivered and I've had a chance to use it, I'll post more.I'm getting to know the camera and will share some images.

Reviews.Title: Least Amount of Shutter Lag
Reviews.Author: Jeff R. Clow
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost six months and have used it extensively in the pool.  It does a much better job at underwater photography than the competition in this price range....and the shutter lag is much less than the others.  That's a big deal when you're shooting underwater.  A really BIG deal.The images it produces are somewhat flat but a bit of post processing work can bring out the color in underwater shots.  It does a mediocre job on sport shots and an okay job above the water line as well, but if you're looking for something that does a decent job underwater, you should seriously consider this model.  Watch for price drops - the pricing fluctuates a lot on this model.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumis DMC-TS10 waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: infrequent
Reviews.Content: Product arrived on time, well-packaged, intact, good documentation.Tested it successfully before heading to Hawaii, used it while snorkeling, ziplining, and sightseeing, played with all the settings, very pleased with the results.  Now my teenaged granddaughter is getting excellent results with it.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine for a year ...
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: It worked fine for a year, although not exposed to real underwater.  Just a few rolls in a kayak once in a while.  Sometimes it got foggy after a few rolls.  Anyway, it stopped working after a year of use.  Camera will start but buttons will not work at all ( except for the on/off button ).  Not what's to be  expected from a 200 dollar.

Reviews.Title: Not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: N. Dill
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera at Christmas in 2010, and until this week, had only used it in the boat and in wet environments. We had never used it underwater. On a trip to St Maarten, we snorkeled with it several times, wiped it off after each use, and waited a while before we opened it. Each time there was a tiny amount (drop or two) of water at the access door. By the end of the trip, the viewfinder had fogged, so that the last pictures are cloudy. The viewer on the back had white spots on it. The viewfinder finally cleared, as did the white spots, and it works again, but I won't use it underwater again with any great expectations. The depth it was submerged was probably 3 feet max, with no diving below the surface.The biggest problem I have with it is being able to see what I'm photographing to compose a shot. In certain kinds of light, the back view screen just doesn't show what you are looking at and is virtually black. Underwater, it was often a guess as to whether what you pointed toward was actually what you were taking a picture of. The pictures are very clear (when the glass doesn't fog), but the picture you get just may not be what you thought you were taking.I think Nikon has made a similar camera with a separate viewfinder. Daughter may get this one.

Reviews.Title: It leaks and quits
Reviews.Author: R. Dreher
Reviews.Content: This new camera was used at Baby Beach, Aruba for less than 30 minutes of snorkeling. It leaked and stopped working completely despite all the precautions in the instruction manual. It almost ruined my Caribbean snorkling adventure but I bought another digital camera in Aruba and put it in a Vivitar underwater bag. That worked ( but the optics of the bag were awful). The TS10 , used in the ocean, should be used in a waterproof camera bag to be sure that water does not leak in.  It took over a week for the camera to dry out and start working again. But it may have been damaged by corrosion from the experience. I will be looking for a better transparent camera bag if I take it underwater again.

Reviews.Title: excellent for fun
Reviews.Author: D. E. Merino "rastiazul"
Reviews.Content: Ive had it for around 6 months, used it around 20 times always for surfing. Only strange issue is that sometimes everything comes up with a blue color, it is clear but all blue. Also note it takes a couple of seconds to start filming.Surf Anything!

Reviews.Title: Camera works really well
Reviews.Author: Sukhada Fadnavis
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about buying this camera because of some of the reviewers mentioning that their's stopped working within a few days. Mine worked great throughout my 7 day trip. I was using it under water for around two hours every day. The underwater pictures are great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Hanke
Reviews.Content: We took this camera on a trip to Florida and we are delighted with it.  We used it in shallow water for snorkeling and for a bunch of beach type pictures.  It took excellent pictures and we had no problems with water getting into the camera.  We kept the rubber case on the whole time and were extra careful about opening the "door" for the battery and flash card.  Everyone has commented about how clear the pics are and yes, you do have to plan ahead for the monster sized files but that's OK.  Excellent purchase!

Reviews.Title: decent camera but limited
Reviews.Author: C. Wong "Tech enthusiast!"
Reviews.Content: It is 2012 as of this review so this camera is falling behind in terms of other point and shoot cameras on the market which offer full 1080p video with stereo mics compared to the mono mic on the ts10.  My review will be focused on the actual use of the camera and it's oddities.I'm a canon user and switching to the ts10 was odd as the menu system isn't as intuitive as canon's.video- battery life is pretty decent for the camera and can capture roughly 2 hours of straight video footage until the battery depletes itself.-- maximum recording clip limit is 47 minutes and 47 seconds ( used a 8gb micro sdhc card with a sd card adapter)- this camera is pretty bad for low light video recording- audio control is limited and tends to distort sometimes when loud noises are present.- optical stabilization is effective- cannot zoom while shooting video- you must pre focus your video before recording.  This camera does not refocus while shooting video which is annoying- manual whitebalance is a nice feature when recording video- camera seems to be aimed towards underwater users and hiking enthusiasts.- image quality is average.  More megapixels does not mean better image quality.  I hate how camera manufactures try to confuse consumers that more megapixels = better.  It is very deceiving

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Peter Z. Simpson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife who was looking for a rugged, waterproof camera for casual photos when hiking or on the water. Though it's rated only to 10 feet rather than the 40 feet of Panasonic's TS3, it *is* waterproof (tested snorkeling in the Florida Keys) and takes great underwater pictures. I had no problems importing the photos into her Mac. The battery life seems good (it lasted me all day). It's a perfect size to slip into her purse as a higher quality and more rugged alternative to her iPhone. A good (and half-price!) alternative the TS3 model if you want occasional shallow-water use or a camera that can survive a thorough soaking.

Reviews.Title: TOUGH Works Well
Reviews.Author: Saul
Reviews.Content: I'm in a combat zone in Afghanistandropped my camera on a hard roadHumvee promptly ran over itSTILL WORKS GREAT!Got it for 135 USD over here

Reviews.Title: this camera is the worst!
Reviews.Author: busybee
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my Olympus Tough 1030SW became waterlogged.  That camera was the best and I was so sad to discover that it is no longer made and that I couldn't even get it repaired.  I therefore chose to go with the Panasonic Lumix TS10 because the reviews were pretty good and because one of the reviews for the latest model in the Tough series mentioned it wasn't as good as the 1030sw.  I have had this Panasonic camera for four months now and I really don't like it.  Nearly every photo taken using the flash, gives the subject red eyes.  Yes, there is a red-eye reduction flash option but from my experience with taking photos, not every picture had red-eyed subjects when the flash was used.  It's very annoying to have to photoshop all of my photos.  The pictures also turn out very orange, even with the flash on!  This camera is the worst.  The only reason I gave it two stars rather than one star is because it has done a good job being waterproof.  Another terribly annoying thing with this camera is that I have a lot of trouble getting the photos from the camera onto my computer.  Sometimes when I plug the camera to my computer they will transfer quickly without incident but 75% of the time, the battery of the camera will drain before the camera even establishes a connection to the computer.  This has already happened to me today.  I attached the cable as normal and pushed the button to connect to my PC but after literally, 45 minutes, I just turned the camera off because it still hadn't connected.  I turned the camera off and back on and tried again but no luck and the battery is now about to die.  Don't purchase this camera!  It's not worth the money and frustration!  I have started researching waterproof/shockproof cameras once again.If it matters... I own the blue lumix.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for Work Environment
Reviews.Author: Rhonda K.
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras for work. The field technicians at my office have to document environmental conditions and subcontractor work and the cameras we've had in the past didn't hold up to being dropped on the ground or into a puddle. So far no one has dropped one, so I can't vouch for how well they hold up. I think the silicon sleeve that came with each camera helps to keep a grip on it, so people are less likely to drop them when they're walking through mud and such. The pictures come out clear and crisp and the menu isn't too hard to navigate. When I bought these I got the "package" deal, which came with an 8 GB memory card and an ultra compact camera case from Case Logic. The case is only big enough to fit the camera without the silicon sleeve, so it's pretty useless for my application. But the cameras are great and I'm happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, nothing more  to say
Reviews.Author: Glen
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, nothing else to add or say sincerely. I really love the idea of going to the beach, or wherever is water without thinking that I am goind to damage the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff Marvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this little camera, exactly what she wanted and takes great pictures too.  Love that it's water proof, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: wanted to love this, but..........
Reviews.Author: Never pay retail
Reviews.Content: I got my camera from Amazon Warehouse deals so it had been returned or refurbished.  It worked fine out of the box but the second day I tried to turn it on, the on button would not work.  After about 5 minutes of pushing the button I got it to turn on.  Then it would not turn off.  Had to pull the battery to get it to turn off.  Then I put it back in the box to be returned.  SAD!  Hope you have better luck with yours if you decide to buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Clicking noises?
Reviews.Author: Dr. Milan Vodicka "drmv"
Reviews.Content: I owned and used this camera for more than half a year. It performed perfectly for my intended use. Unfortunately, I lost it.Now - and hence this review that is really a question, rather than statements about the camera attributes. I ordered a replacement one. When it arrived I observed clicking noises when I handled it. When shaken, something rattled inside. Since I never observed anything like this with my previous camera, I chose to return it as "defective." By the way, my purchase was through Amazon and Abe's of Maine. Their service was prompt and excellent, including the authorization for the return.The question: Is this clicking normal, or is it a malfunction or defect of some kind? I would appreciate to know. There is no mention of it that I could find in any documentation.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for snorkeling!
Reviews.Author: StephanieC
Reviews.Content: I used this camera on a recent trip where I snorkeled.  It was wonderful!  Previously, I had used a disposable underwater camera.  When I had the photos developed, I found that I had mostly taken photos with my finger in it.  It's so hard to see through that little hole with a mask on!  With this camera, we came home with hundreds of wonderful photos!I found this camera to be very easy to use while underwater.  The controls are intuitive and easy to see.  It was a good size for holding while wet and I could see the large screen very well.  I used this camera with a float strap just in case we would have dropped it.The photo quality was great.  I don't think that anything can truly capture the beauty under the sea, but this camera comes close.  We also took several videos and they were also great.  I loved that we could review the photos back on land while still on the trip instead of waiting to have film developed.I don't have any complaints about this camera.  I do wish that I had gotten a screen protector for the back, as I got a few scratches, probably from rocks in the ocean.  If you read the directions and take care of the camera, you should have no problems with its underwater performance!  My husband and I passed it back and forth so much while snorkeling that I'll be buying another one before our next trip!

Reviews.Title: Perfect rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Ragland
Reviews.Content: My wife loves this camera. She prefers to use this camera. She kept asking for something compact that was rugged and waterproof. This is great for water parks, the coast, the lake, river fishing, and hiking. We were surprised to see that the indoor shots in regular lighting turned out much clearer and better than her old camera. We paired this with the Chums floating strap which is a must if you do anything in water. It maybe waterproof, but if you drop it in a lake, it will sink like a rock. Overall we are very pleased with this purchase, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Its OK, not great
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Endrizzi "dreezman"
Reviews.Content: Video is excellent. Pictures are so so, they seem grainy - especially indoor. I expected more.I'm keeping it because it seems rugged and I beat cameras up.

Reviews.Title: Steal of a Deal
Reviews.Author: E. Mish
Reviews.Content: So far I am liking this camera... bought it "used" from Amazon Warehouse deals for $114.. I had been eying up the lumix cameras for awhile now and at that price i couldn't pass.. from what i read most items marked as "used" in the warehouse are return items or blemished boxes.. when i got my camera it was sealed shut with sticks guaranteeing its condition from Amazon.. It looked like it was opened.. tested.. and put back in the box.. none of the cables were even opened.. it was basically a brand new camera.. I must say I am honestly impressed and will watch the "used" section.. mainly Warehouse Deals.. a lot more for the next steal of a deal

Reviews.Title: Good for snow
Reviews.Author: adrian
Reviews.Content: this camara is grate for the snow... i loved it!! it doesnt fog at all and actually i have put in it in the snow... havent' try the camera inside water... but so far so good

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, just got it for Christmas and used it on a cruise last week and loved the video feature. I was able to walk at a normal pace and no blur and recorded the sound at the same time. I can catch pictures of my 2 year old granddaughter, a continually moving target, and they are sharp and clear so the shutter speed is quite good.  I also used it while snorkeling in Haiti and got great shots underwater. I carried it up Dunn's River Falls in Jamaica and it's shock proof quality proved successful.  It is simple to use and to play back, small enough in size to fit in a pocket or purse easily.

Reviews.Title: This is one neat little camera, but does not produce optimal underwater photos.
Reviews.Author: hhbva
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to St. Croix, USVI, for the specific purpose of using it for underwater photography while snorkeling in the crystal-clear, blue-green waters of the Caribbean. I will qualify my disappointment over my very mediocre snorkeling shots with the admission that I had never used a camera underwater before. But I found it very hard to use the LCD screen in the water and thus had problems following and focusing on the many colorful fish that were present around Buck Island off St. Croix. Above the water, however, the camera produced spectacular photos in deep, rich colors and sharp detail, of many different scenes, including sailing and swim shots, sea- and landscapes, night photos, portraits, street scenes, and even excellent aerial photography. My favorites, however, are the sunset photos of the palm-fringed Caribbean beaches; they are truly breathtaking, almost better than what I have been able to produce with my Sony DSC-R1 with its premium Carl Zeiss Vario-Sonnar f/2.8 telephoto zoom lens. The Lumix DMC-TS10 proved sturdy and durable, simple to operate, and it is, indeed, waterproof. I found that it does not require a lot of coddling to keep it that way if one follows the simple precautions. I even dropped it on the ocean floor because I was careless in not tightening the carrying strap sufficiently to prevent its slipping off my wrist. Fortunately, one of the snorkeling tour guides was quick to recognize what had happened and dove in the water to retrieve the camera unharmed. I'm almost certain that, with some additional practice, my next snorkeling trip will produce better underwater photos.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for 4 year old
Reviews.Author: David Johnson "satisfied"
Reviews.Content: Christmas gift to our 4 year old grand daughter.  All kids are tech savvy and this was the prefect Christmas gift.  With 16 gig SD chip She can take thousands of pics.  Has the soft plastic skin to aid protection.  Our 2 year old grand daughter is also enamored with it.  We've seen flower close up photographic study as well as the Christmas happy pics....  great creative gift.

Reviews.Title: Awesome shots!
Reviews.Author: Lauren Powers
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great close-up shots, very impressed with its quality. Still learning how to change some settings, but very happy with my choice!

Reviews.Title: Water proof camera
Reviews.Author: trapfly18holes
Reviews.Content: This is my second Lumix. One I own is not water proof so I got this one. This camera is larger than non waterproof Lumix which I did not think before I bought.  14mega pixels is good. What I don't understand is camera came with semi transparent rubber soft case goes over camera. After taking photos you got to take this rubber out from camera to open side door to connect computer port. I don't like this method.  If you take photos frequent downloading cause this rubber case ripped very first and life of water proofing will be unknown. I still not sure.Camera will not fit in neoporine camera case.

Reviews.Title: Great durable camera for better price
Reviews.Author: W J T "WJT"
Reviews.Content: I have had several point and shoots over the years. A few were lost to bumps and dropping, one to rain. This one eliminates those worries and takes amazing pictures on auto mode. Dropped it in 6' of water after overturning a kayak. Plucked it out and was taking pictures again seconds later. Skid Big Sky Montana with it for 3 days around my neck outside my jacket - worked like a dream the whole time.Since I bought mine my brother, sister, and mom all bought the same one!!Love Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera...Great "Bang for the Buck"...
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other 5 star reviews. It's a good camera for the $129.95 price. I've had it about a month now & used it for all of our holiday pictures. Looking forward to using it this summer while kayaking, one of the reasons I wanted the waterproof feature.It got a recommended rating from Consumer Reports, which was another reason I bought it. Taking low light pictures at the telephoto end sometimes did produce blurred photos, but I emphasize "sometimes". All of the other features seem to work well.I also purchased the Case Logic TBC 302Ultra Compact Camera Case, which the camera fits into perfectly. Good deal for the $5.64 I paid for it. It also holds a memory card & spare battery. I suggest getting them both.Memory Card:  Transcend 8 GB SDHC Class 6 TS8GSDHC6E ($11.99) good for 1600 still photos, which is more then enough for whatever trip you're taking. You only get about 10 shots with the built in card. The only thing I don't like is having to connect the USB cable to my PC when downloading the photos to it. With my older camera I just need to plug in the memory card. Might be the card since it's "High Capacity" or the camera. Have a feeling it's the way the camera functions. No big deal.Battery:  Maximal Power DMW BCH7 Li-Ion ($12.75) works well & is made for this camera. The batteries both the one that come with the camera & this one don't seem to last as long as the three AA batteries I use in my old Sony Digital but it's not a big deal, plus my Sony is a lot bigger & heavier then this camera. That's why it pays to get a back up, plus it takes only 1 ½ hours to fully charge it, which can be done while having dinner & be ready for your next days shooting. Consumer Report rates the one that comes with the camera for 300 shots, this back up seems to do just as good.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: A. D. McDonald "LibraryWoman"
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality. I love the features on it (which are easy to use if you watch the disc that comes with the camera). It has a program that does the the thinking for you as far as light, zoom, etc. Did some great wildlife shots just in my own backyard and the camera even shot clearly through a window screen. Finally took it to the beach today and did several under water photos. It was easy to dry to get the card out. I am really happy with it and I'm a nervous nelly when it comes to buying electronics.

Reviews.Title: It's a good underwater camera, but bad camera otherwise
Reviews.Author: Caroline A. Ginnane
Reviews.Content: It works well with video, both underwater and out of the water, but regular pictures are not too good.I don't like how every time I turn on the camera, I have to acknowledge a pop up warning about how I need to review the underwater instructions. This happens EVERY time I turn the camera on. ANNOYING!Also, the menu is not very easy to use, for example, if you have it on video, then want to turn it on and take a picture, you can't switch modes from the external camera buttons- you have to turn the camera on, and then go into the menu and switch over from there, so it takes a long time to get the camera set up for the mode you want. My old Sony camera let me handle all that from the external camera buttons.Video is decent, but it makes HUGE files which take forever to upload.
