In fact, when uploading about 20 short videos from my last trip, it took so long to upload them that the fully charged camera battery died before they could all upload!Also, after this attempt, my computer no longer recognizes the pictures on the camera/ memory stick and it won't let me upload them to my computer. Sucks.Make sure if when you're taking water photos, you don't have any water drops on the lense, or you will have water drops on your photos. This happens when you submerge the camera, then take photos in the water, but holding the camera above the water.Summary: I wouldn't buy this camera. It's got too many issues with useability and quality. Just buy the cheaper Kodak underwater camera, and get a decent regular camera.

Reviews.Title: Better Then I Thought
Reviews.Author: KP
Reviews.Content: This is an AWESOME camera. Took it to Punta Cana played in the ocean left it in the sand and it was ok. It comes with really good directions and if you follow them then you won't mess the camera up. The only downside is that there is a huge lag in-between pictures and there is no zoom on the video feature.

Reviews.Title: Worked great!
Reviews.Author: Ivy
Reviews.Content: Took this on a bahamas vacation and to a water park.  I love that it comes with a silicone sleeve so the camera itself doesn't get too banged around and scratched up.  The video was a great thing to have for the water slides!  Shutter speed was decent, picture quality was pretty darn good compared to some other waterproof cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: GFT21710
Reviews.Content: I searched extensively for a decent camera for snorkeling and decided on this Lumix, which in the black model sold for $129.  It has some really nice features and takes great land pictures.  This makes it a great buy in itself.  Add in the waterproofing and this is the only camera to buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: packfan
Reviews.Content: Just had my first child and bought this as a quick point and shoot in all conditions.  Simply said, this camera is AWESOME.  I have not missed a single magic moment and absolutely love the quality of the images in all lighting conditions.  It's also so durable that I hang it from a lanyard around my neck, no need for a camera case that gets in the way when you need to point and shoot quickly

Reviews.Title: Nice water proof camera
Reviews.Author: Shihwen Huang
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good.  The picture quality is acceptable but still have some differences compared with regular camera.  However, the camera can do water proof with this budget price.  It's good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-TS10
Reviews.Author: skier
Reviews.Content: The camera is performing well, I didn't drop it down, or immerse in water, yet.Good quality pictures.Quite happy so far. I used Pentax Optio W20 7.0 Megapixel Digital Camera and albeit it was working well underwater, it had some picture issues - double edges in some situation. Lumix is much better.I will use it while skiing and on the beach.

Reviews.Title: buy this.
Reviews.Author: dendenmushi
Reviews.Content: I studied many water cameras before buying this.  One website did comparing tests with other competitive cameras.  This one was one of the most totally recommended careras ( the site did verious tests)  Quality of pics is pretty good and so far no problem.  We use it a lot in our pool which encouraged my 4 year old son to put his face in the water.  Sometimes, we leave the camera out in the hot sun, but no damege so far. pretty happy over all.

Reviews.Title: What a treat!
Reviews.Author: Foob "happy camper"
Reviews.Content: Took the cam swimming this weekend. Kids were impressed with the underwater videos complete with them blowing air bubbles and all. There are all kinds of angles you can shoot when you are not worried about the cam getting wet! Only complaint so far is no zoom while recording videos. Hi-sensitivity feature is very nice for shots in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Very good cost benefit!
Reviews.Author: Rafael H. L. Garcia "Teo"
Reviews.Content: The photos are great.Pros:-Nice looking blued camera-good lens (sharp pictures when there is a lot of light available)-OIS stabilizer seems very good to take shots when there is less available light-waterproof and shockproof(go to the beach or anywere and don't have to care about sand, dust of rain...)-good silicone skin (probably it gives an extra protection for shocks)-very good price4 instead of 5 stars because:Cons:-35mm instead of 28mm lens-The battery doesn't last more than 1 day if you make a lot of pics (around 200 pics a day)-Every time I opened the battery compartiment it was a little wet. The camera is still working, but after a week diving every day I saw a metal piece oxidized.

Reviews.Title: Great Vacation Camera
Reviews.Author: Bartski
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I decided to purchase the Panasonic Lumix for water use on a recent vacation.  We used it in the pool, for snorkeling, and parasailing with absolutely no issues!  As long as you clean it as directed in the instructions, there should be little chance of water getting in around the seals.The image quality is as expected from a point-and-shoot.  Daylight images are very nice, while low light and flash images are less impressive.  While it will not replace my DSLR for all shooting, it is definitely great to have when you are in situations where the camera may be exposed to moisture.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam - Still must improve
Reviews.Author: Danilo
Reviews.Content: The cam is ok, the Artificial Intelligent mode works good in the day, but at night its settings for ISO is really not good. Panasonic must improve the quality for night shots...One detail: while recording a video the cam doesn't let you zoom, it just stops when you are recording a video.All in all, I can recommend this acquirement.

Reviews.Title: Strictly a Beach/Pool Camera for Me
Reviews.Author: Trekker "Gabe"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: BEFORE YOU BUY A WATERPROOF CAMERA, PLEASE CLICK THE LINK BELOW FOR A DISCOURAGING WRITE UP ON WATERPROOF CAMERAS.  IT JUST MIGHT CHANGE YOUR MIND ABOUT PURCHASING A "WATERPROOF" CAMERA.[ ... ]---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I knew before purchasing this camera that all waterproof cameras compromise on picture quality. I bought this inexpensive waterproof camera with the intent of strictly using it on the beach to get photos we would normally miss because of my fear of risking damage to my Nikon dSLR or Canon S90.  This camera serves that purpose.  I would not recommend this camera as an overall or everyday camera though.  It really does lack in several areas.  One big disappointment was the lack of quality for low light conditions (including lighted indoor shots).  For these shots, the camera relies too much on high ISO settings and results in grainy washed out photos.  The other disappointment was the lcd screen.  The screen is not vivid at all and its resolution leaves a lot to be desired.  It does seem like the camera takes decent outdoor shots when plenty of light is available.  Which takes me back to why I bought this camera in the first place, well lit beach photos.  So I think I will be fine.Bottome line: This camera will serve its purpose for me on the beach, pool etc., but I will use my other 2 cameras everywhere else.  Its a niche camera that will only be used if its too hazardous for my other 2.  Would not recommend this as your everyday camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but focus can be an issue
Reviews.Author: J. C. Brown
Reviews.Content: I can't give it four stars for three reasons:1) Focus is not dependable.  I have taken 100+ photos in various conditions such as water, bright sun, low light, etc. Approximately 20 of the shots were out of focus.  This included completely dry shots.2) High ISO shots are very grainy.  They should have a max ISO setting on this camera.  I own their high end compact camera, and I set the max ISO at 400 on it.3) For video, the mic is weak.  Picture looks good, but sound recording is very low volume.It may be the best alternative out there for form, function and price.  Just don't expect 100% satisfaction.  I take extra shots knowing some will be out of focus.Overall I'm between "Its OK" and "I like it".

Reviews.Title: Bought This Camera for Its Compact Size, Light Weight, And Speediness!
Reviews.Author: Consumer Advocate
Reviews.Content: I already have several Lumix compact digital cameras; all are larger and heavier than the TS10.I want a camera that can turn on and be ready for action quickly. I also want the camera to shut down fast and not waste time retracting its lens.The TS10 is perfect, because it does not have a retractable lens. The camera is ready to take pictures almost as soon as you press the on/off button. Shutting down is just as fast.4X zoom is good enough for me; I don't shoot too much telephoto pictures. It is nonetheless optical zoom, not image-degrading digital zoom in lessor cameras.Because of its speediness, this is truly a point-and-shoot, street photography camera.That it is also shock-proof and water-proof make it a even better all-around, all-weather camera.

Reviews.Title: No lens protection - WHAT were they thinking?!
Reviews.Author: Waltzing Matilda
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera for amateurs like me. It takes beautiful pictures and the basics are a snap to figure out. It has enough features so that as I get more familiar with the equipment and more skilled in photography, it will have all the capability I am likely to need. The waterproof/dropable/freeze resistant attributes make me comfortable taking it absolutely anywhere. But . . . what idiot decided to leave the lens unprotected? Put it in a pocket and it will be scratched by keys and coins; pull it out of your pocket and it gets fingerprints; hold it in your hand and dust or rain will get splattered on it. I've had to jury-rig a cover out of cloth and Velcro so I don't have to take time to clean the lens every time I take a picture.

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Great!
Reviews.Author: S. Henson
Reviews.Content: This camera is magnificent.  It is durable and reliable.  It takes great, high quality photos and offers a number of options when snapping photos.  The HD video on here is quite good also.  The fact that it works underwater is awesome and more importantly, I love the fact that it is shockproof.  This is probably the best digital camera I have purchased.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Andy. V
Reviews.Content: The camera has features that allow you to capture all the high-speed action, and has optical image stabilization that will keep your images sharp. You even have face detection for better portraits. If the image is better captured in motion, the camera can take HD movies. All of these features make the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS10 the take-with-you-everywhere camera, no matter where you go or what you do.Overall, this thing is amazing for almost anything outdoors, i took a few pictures under water near a coral reef, what amazing detail this camera can take.

Reviews.Title: Great for snorkeling
Reviews.Author: hyf
Reviews.Content: I purchased the DMC-T510 for a trip to Bora Bora.  It arrived right on time (and the day before we left!).  I have another Lumix camera (DMC-ZX1), so getting set up was simple.  I also bought the recommended 8g memory card through Amazon.  No problems with the battery life or memory capacity -- I only had to charge it up once during 9 days, and didn't run out of memory.The 510 is compact and convenient.  Its waterproof feature was the main reason I purchased it, and it came in very handy on a day-long snorkel cruise when we encountered lots of ocean spray.  Most importantly, I used it as an underwater camera while snorkeling -- both still photos and movies.  If you are a snorkeler who doesn't go far below the surface (it is rated down to 3 meters/10 feet), the camera is fine.  I got a particularly impressive movie swimming amongst reef sharks!  The camera also takes reasonable pictures above water, providing the different pre-settings available on other Lumix camers.  The resolution is good for a "point-and-shoot", although noticeably less sharp than the Lumix DMC-ZX1 (which has a Leica lens).The 510 comes with a silicon cover which both prevents accidental opening of the battery and connection ports, and it also provides protection -- a plus.  Soaking the camera in clear water after use in sea water was not a big deal, and it dried off quickly.Overall, I'm pleased my purchase.  The 510 is great for both above water (splashy) times, it can take pretty good pictures as a "point & shoot", but it really comes to the fore under water.  We vacation yearly in Hawaii, and this camera is going to come along every time.

Reviews.Title: great travel camera
Reviews.Author: tj "luvs shoes"
Reviews.Content: great travel camera.  takes great photos and you won't need to worry about it getting wet. make sure to follow the underwater instructions!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, whimpy zoom
Reviews.Author: RandyR1963
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has worked as promised. User friendly and intuitive controls. The 4x zoom isn't much, but was a trade-off for the waterproof/shockproof ruggedness. I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: great buy.
Reviews.Author: AmazonJunkie "Sam"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great results and for the price, I just really love the crispness I get from this. I haven't tried it underwater but I will definitely update my review when I do get a chance to take pictures underwater. for now, great buy for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-TS10
Reviews.Author: Edward Frederick
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and somewhat rugged camera.  I have purchased 7 Lumix cameras so far (some given as gifts) and am very pleased with all of them.  This is the first rugged one, and I am thinking about getting another to give as a Christmas gift.  My daughter uses this one on a weekly basis.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Fine Camerra
Reviews.Author: Kent Sherrow
Reviews.Content: Not nuts about the view finder,  but it is what is reported. I would like to see a case with it to help with the waterproof theme.

Reviews.Title: Circles of Light on Basic photos
Reviews.Author: M. Wells
Reviews.Content: I'm not a super photography buff. I just want to take some decent snapshots of my family and occasionally take some videos. On several of the photos I took, there were circles of light. (They resembled bubbles.) I have had three Canons. NONE of them had this problem. The only reason we were trying a different brand was because the Canons are so fragile. One drop and they're toast. So, I am back to getting a Canon with the hopes that we can keep it from falling.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS10
Reviews.Author: cstucker45
Reviews.Content: Great Camera but I have to take 2 pics and change from normal to inteligent auto every time to see what setting works best.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot College gift
Reviews.Author: R. Overall
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these, one red, one orange, for graduating college nephew and graduating high school.  They used it on a family trip abroad, and liked them.  Small, water resistant, adequate for a point-and-shoot purposes, the photo copies sent to me were quite good.  They felt the camera did a good job in most situations, though (as is common) low light situations were less than ideal.  Still, both boys are active, the camera fits their often hectic lifestyles at school, dating, at the beach, etc.  Remembering my own college days, they wouldn't want a bulky camera, or one that requires a lot of fiddling to get a picture or put it on their computers.  So they tell me that for everyday photos, where they want a little more than a smartphone's limited ability, but don't want to haul out some hi-def SLR (if they had one) either, this rugged little cam fits that niche perfectly.  Glad it "hit the spot" for them.  This is a very good point-and-shoot.  However, I am told Panasonic quit making the batteries for them, so make sure to buy a spare if you can find one, or find a source for a third party battery is available.  I like my Lumix cameras, but their batteries are commonly available.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures during the day...
Reviews.Author: Zuco
Reviews.Content: I haven't been able to get good pictures at night. I'm no camera expert, and I han a big Canon fan. I chose this camera for its ruggedness. Canon beats Panasonic and Sony on night and dark conditions.This model is a bit too big, I would rather go with the Sony option, unless the price is an issue. Sony is almost twice as expensive.All in all is a good camera, great price, good option for the pool, beach, skying or field work.Cheers.

Reviews.Title: Lumix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: FrannyBannany
Reviews.Content: I just bought this item. I have only used it a couple of times so far. I subscribe to the magazine SmartShop, it recommended this camera. I think I am going to enjoy it very much when I learn how to use it and can use it more.

Reviews.Title: Camera for an active family
Reviews.Author: Jane Jackson
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my daughter and her family.  Hope it lives up to its "billing" of being waterproof, freezeproof and shatterproof!

Reviews.Title: One Stinky Piece Of Poop
Reviews.Author: JustinDK
Reviews.Content: This is crappy camera when it comes down to indoor or night shooting, which as far as I'm concerned, is when a point and shoot is going to be most used, and the first purchase I've regretted in a long time.  Low-lighting shots with a flash give almost any blue-eyed person red eye (even when red eye function is turned on).  It also washes any light colored objects out to where they can't be salvaged in post editing.  Low-lighting with out a flash is of course blurry and has a red hue to every picture.  Outside pictures are fine.  I took better pictures in low light with my old 10 mp Canon Powershot, that cost half as much.

Reviews.Title: died young
Reviews.Author: Mark J. Rosen "hatetoshop"
Reviews.Content: had hoped this would finally be my durable camera.  the menu button stopped working after 1 day.  disappointed would not buy again returned

Reviews.Title: ARTICLE IS DAMAGE
Reviews.Author: ANDREINA
Reviews.Content: Hey, buy the camera, and used according to instructions, but when using the item under water, was shut down, did not return to work but never, the article had any insurance that indicated was due to use, according to the manual instruction. Do not recommend

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof, not made well
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Not waterproof. Waste of money. This camera is definitely a down grade from the TS2.  Within 5 minutes of using it in the water, the camera was wrecked.  My memory card was destroyed and all of my photos were gone, memories that I couldn't get back.  Despite the fact that there were obvious manufacturing defects,(and my camera was only a few weeks old) Panasonic refused to give me a new camera, but would only provide me with a 2nd hand refurbished model.  Don't buy it

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS10 14.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy Daugherty "bookster"
Reviews.Content: unfortuately i have not had the time to review this product yet although i know that i have made a good purchase.
